label: 寺家行事
本: Court and Bakufu in Japan:  Essays in Kamakura History . Stanford University Press . 1982
説明文: The Hōjō practice of assigning warrior officials to oversee the affairs of Rinzai Zen monasteries. The policy was initiated by Sadatoki and Takatoki, in the late thirteenth and early fourteenth centuries, to assert Bakufu control over the growing network of Zen temples.　[臨済宗、北条貞時、北条高時]
